TRIPLETTE has never be exposed to anything quite like this before and stands a l awe of the situation. When the twirling and tricking and music stop, BARBARA JE descends the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hasn't heard)  It's hard to say. Doctors thought  she'd come home a week ago. All it  was was appendix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Well, I could use one, especially  if I'm pregnant.

dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said, maybe I'll change my name  again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see... Well, those doctors are  real miracle workers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But not unless Nashville really  inspires me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you can look after me a  little.

dialogues.text: speeding by each vehicle. BARBARA JEAN and BARNETT are al

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had these two city boys come in  last week. One or them said his  Ford truck had cut off his foot.  The other one said that wasn't true.  Then the first said he looked just  like Eddie Black when he said  that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, would you be sure to get the  oil changed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya... where do you want me to take  it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember Eddie Black? He had  those blue eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you always take it. There's  nothing special about this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they started pounding on each  other. But the one without the foot  was strongest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bud, you're going to have to show  up at the hospital tar me I gotta  get back to that session.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Anything you want me to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say I had to get back to the  session. ~ God -- All school did  for you, you can put in a thimble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops came through and broke it  up. I finally just had to call Chet  and say, 'Chet, get over here. There  are two old bays here breaking up  the furniture...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUELEEN in doing some vocal exercising. WADE listens for

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you're going to sing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- That's exercises. My coach  says you have to do exercise because  the vocal chords are muscle and need  to be stretched. Every time you  stretch them, the middle part sets  stronger. That's the place where I  sing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I got any kind of a  voice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He breaks into a scale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure do it loud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I should take lessons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're serious. Being serious  is real important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade -- I've been working toward  this audition for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, honey, I sure hope it comes  your way then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it will?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just knew that was you when you  got on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya - I even recognized them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you been together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is your rather really an actor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) All his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all laugh. STEW #4 has been driving over-cautiously of the cargo. TOM leans over and kisses her ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You having any fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shrieks and practically drives off the road. They all

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the most important thing -- to have -- fun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long are you going to be here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long enough to have fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think of him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hal? Well, Hal and I have been  friends for a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go to school together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we never did that

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're connected by a relative. One  time, one of his aunts married one  of my uncles. That was a long time  ago, though. How'd you come to work  for him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I really think he's got a  chance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yea -- There has never been a  better time for something new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ain't really new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is to a lot of people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a good Judge, but that was a  long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I'll bet you he makes it  with a majority.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Southern California.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always live there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spent time in Arizona. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I admire your optimism, and I  just wondered if it was regional.  You ever see any movie stars?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know a couple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kidding -- Wait till I tell  Linnea. Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... Peter Finch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter Finch -- he's English.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never heard of him. Name  somebody else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan O'Neal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really do?  ~ God -- How come  you know them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you meet them at parties and  stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be damned. Boy, if you could  get Ryan to say something about Hal  Phillip Walker, wouldn't that be  something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- maybe. Let's see what  happens here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be dammed.

dialogues.speaker: AIRPORT BUS
dialogues.text: GLENN is at the window. "Connie White" ads are present.

dialogues.speaker: MOBILE HOME
dialogues.text: Part of normal traffic. It belongs to TOMMY BROWN, who lo with four very black associates, playing serious poker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joining the procession from an auxiliary route. With her OPAL, who interviews LINNEA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have your children been deaf since  birth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes -- yes, they have. It was a  real shock at first, especially  since my daddy's a preacher, but  Delbert and I have been blessed by  their being here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you start singing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was little, in church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't it unusual for you to be  working with a black choir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, can you tell me why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It just is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not getting the  answer she wants) How long have you been with them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About three years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just my church and my boys. We all  had to go to school and learn hand  talking. I just thank the Lord they  can see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you ever do any writing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a close friend of Haven's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, mostly his wife's. She's in  Paris, France, right now. My  husband Delbert is real friendly  with him. Delbert's in law. Does  work for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a member of our congregation.

dialogues.speaker: KENNY'S NASH
dialogues.text: KENNY is caught up in the crowd entering Nashville.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't lose it. Last time I  gave you twenty-five dollars, you  lost it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that just happened that time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it better not happen again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALBUQUERQUE turns and looks out the window. They ride in  resentful silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lost twenty-five dollars once  before that, too, near Christmas  time -- I remember that real well  now. December 9th, to be exact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a real good memory, Star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember when I just saw you.  Skinny Winnifred. Jesus, you were  skinny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring him) What do you have to buy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feed, mostly. Thought we'd get  something for the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay by me - I'd sure like to see  that Opryland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grand Old Opera --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate that music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that, Star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near a bridge, a huge diesel truck almost collides with t Replacement car, which has just made a greedy move. To avoid collision, the diesel jackknifes, blocking all t behind it, except for one narrow lane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY sits erect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILL climbs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman, just sit there and don't  puke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He runs toward the truck. At this point, the TRICYCLE MAN appears through all the cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TRICYCLE MAN works his way through traffic. STAR has from his truck and goes to help. ALBUQUESQUE takes advant runs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It overheats and explodes. KENNY gets out, carrying his v case and starts to walk. ALBUQUERQUE spots him and steps

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, mind if I walk with ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks at his violin case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You a musician?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Thanks... I'll... go say hello to  your mom.

dialogues.text: Oh... Well... Have you heard from  Barnett?

dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just be in here.

dialogues.text: Sure do. Good friend of Haven's.

dialogues.text: Haven's not going to talk to me.

dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.text: The architect  His buildings are  drippy. You know, like sand and  castles. Then I got this  assignment. They want to start in  two weeks.

dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.text: What? Oh. A film.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone gave it... Here, you want  this... I'll...

dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.text: We want to send special wishes to  Barbara Jean who is in the Baptist  Hospital. She collapsed yesterday  morning at the plane christening.  Send your prayers and letters to  Baptist Hospital, Nashville,  Tennessee. Barnett said she wept  because she couldn't be here with  you friends and neighbors. But your  faith in the great Almighty will  bring her back here just to be what  you want her to be... And her good  friend, Connie White, has given up  some time with her own mother, who  is sick with a kidney disorder, to  fill in and send her warmth to you  wonderful friends and neighbors so  you won't be too disappointed after  this message from teeth-sticken,  good, gooey clusters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's here somewhere. I had  it when I walked in, but you weren't  here. My name's Albuquerque, and  I'm here cutting a record. My  people said it would be all right.

dialogues.text: Sorry, miss. No pass, no entrance. Your people should hav you a pass.

dialogues.text: They did. I know I'll find it  here.

dialogues.text: CONNIE WHITE passes ALBUQUERQUE and the POLICEMEN on her the bathroom. ALBUQUERQUE rushes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sister Connie... Connie. Hi, I saw  you out there. I just think you're  so beautiful. What do you think?  I  can't find my pass. I'm here  cutting a record, you know, and  these policemen here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The POLICEMEN standing right behind her. They all know sh lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so glad you come for a little  while, and thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could just sit where I was. I  wasn't bothering anybody. That guy  asking everybody questions made more  noise than I ever did. You saw me  there. You signed this program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did. You said, 'your friend,  Connie.'

dialogues.text: CONNIE has disappeared and the POLICE start to usher out  ALBUQUERQUE. She tries to see and hear as:

dialogues.text: After everyone else has gone, KENNY sits alone in the aud

dialogues.text: SUELEEN is in her mirror applying a whole face based upon stars of the forties. She is listening to the OPERA ON th and eating pork and beans and tuna from cans. Her room is with photographs of herself and Catholic symbols. She goe the closet and selects a gown. She is preparing an outfit face for the benefit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We HEAR the tail end of CONNIE WHITE'S SONG on the radio. is intently listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you turn that off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He continues to listen until the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnett, please -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to listen to her sing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't feel that way, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why are you listening to her -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I have to go thank her for  filling in and it's nice to know the  tune she sang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to the King Of the Road and  thank her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARBARA JEAN gets up out of bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well here, why don't you take her  some of these flowers while you're  at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins pulling flowers from various vases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you'd like to work out  something with her, too... Split us  up... Her on the road and me in town  or in the hospital -- (she wails) Barnett!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits down on the floor at the foot of the bed and beg cry. BARNETT backs off. If she was hoping for understandi she is not about to receive it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is wrong with you?   Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He bends down and looks at her with the eyes of a race ho owner whose investment Just collapsed in the stretch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. You're not going  nutsey on me, are you?  Huh...?  You're not going to have one of  those nervous breakdowns or  anything, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Afraid she has gone too far, BARBARA JEAN stops crying an to make everything all right. But she is still choking in own panic of being left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A... No... No, I'm just... I'm  really fine... I just. (she gets up) don't want you to think I'm giving  up or anything like that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNETT looks at her as if from now on he will suspect he secretly being crazy. He begins to pick up the flowers fr floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just take these on over to  her. Show her your appreciation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARBARA JEAN crawls numbly back into her bed, nodding  affirmatively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure... you go on and do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins to shiver. BARNETT looks at her, but he makes attempt to come any closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very small) Barnett?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leans in and pats her arm gingerly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell her thank you, for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARBARA JEAN nods affirmatively, still shivering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (please hold me  voice) Barnett?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She senses he can't go any further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye, bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her again and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye. bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is not out the door before the tears begin again and s into her pillow so he won't hear her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GREEN has come from his wife's room. He sees BARNETT walk the hall. After a moment's deliberation, GREEN enters BAR JEAN'S room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We SEE GREEN come in the door. BARBARA JEAN is sti1l tryi control herself, but is not having much luck with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the pillow) I just get so afraid sometimes.  Then I get more afraid. : Just want  you to hold me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MR. GREEN can't bear what she's saying. He hesitates for minute and then figures what the hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She freezes, thinking BARNETT has come back and she will discounted as totally insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I disturbing you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really all right, Barnett.  Don't you worry really... I just  don't want you to leave me that's  all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and screams at GREEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She scares GREEN, too, but he recovers better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, honey, I didn't mean to scare  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you come in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, my wife, Ester's down the  hall. I saw Barnett leaving and I  was just talking to Ester about your  being here.        She loves you so much,  I just had to come down and say  hello. We've been following you  since you were a girl. Well, I just  scared you to death. I didn't mean  to do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She listens to him. The words somehow comfort her and she to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess you caught me at a  weak moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to speak up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Realizing he can't hear too well makes her feel a little secure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (louder) I said, I've been real tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eater  says she doesn't see how you  do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly) What's wrong with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh just about everything, I guess.  Those doctors started on an overhaul  and don't want to quit. They keep  taking things out. She's going to  come home an egg shell. Tough,  though.. She's tough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you say your name was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARBARA JEAN Well, Mr. Green, you tell those doctors to s whittling and get her some Vitamin E. Have her take that times a day, along with some good meals. If I could cook her, she'd be well in a minute. A NURSE enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Mr. Green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Sherry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you get in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine. We were just talking  about Vitamin S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go on. Ester'1l be very glad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember what I said about the  Vitamins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She watches as he leaves, sorry to see him go.

dialogues.text: LINNEA is getting ready for bed. She wishes TOM would cal PHONE RINGS.

dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.text: Linnea?

dialogues.text: (disappointed) Yes.

dialogues.text: Can you make a rehearsal in the  morning...?  Courtland wants to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up and sighs.

dialogues.text: NORMAN and BILL are there. An ENTERTAINER is singing the WHITE song that CONNIE is doing at the Opera. BILL is eag know where MARY is.

dialogues.text: Maybe she's at the Opera.

dialogues.text: Why the hell would she be there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know goddamn well where she is.

She isn't much in one language and she might just be talking to the OPERATOR, but is sounds impressive.

When she finishes, BARNETT walks thanks her, handing her the flowers. OPAL is still on the phone, now speaking in It

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bastard

dialogues.text: Stop it!

dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.text: You want anything?  A drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no, listen, I don't want to  take up too much of your time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm here putting together a  show. It's a benefit really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: National television?

dialogues.text: Minimum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't support him  We're  registered Democrats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an appearance. It has nothing  to do with support. I don't even  like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill, he's a crazy man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he- expressed a particular  wish to have you on.

dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're real favorites of his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They seem to change viewpoints in a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How come?

dialogues.text: TRIPLETTE settles in like they were old friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First you have to understand how  much he admires you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY and BILL get caught up in the sincerity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sing for people and that's what  he's about. He wants to help  people. Especially now, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILL bypasses all the talk about WALKER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd he ever see us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bluffing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: D.C.?  Tammany Hall?  He came  there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What National TV...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're doing some recording here,  aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An album.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Might be good for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILL takes another shot of tequilla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll sing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRIPLETTE shakes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know how pleased he'll  be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (can't believe  it) What!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILL ignores her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOM is having a serious attack of too much of everything. takes a handful of vitamins, some aspirin and follows it couple of uppers. Then he looks for LINNEA'S phone number There is a KNOCK on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your stomach?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty good. Sure was surprised to  hear from you. You talk to Bill?

dialogues.text: End of Church Street. Next to a  grocery store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't it have a name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't remember. In out/out in,  something like that. Around eight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again she is left with a dead receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOM exits. Behind him is Percy Warner Park and the Parthe L.A. JOAN is with TOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUELEEN works her way through a crowd of men trying to ge the banquet hall. There is a sign that says "Benefit Banq SUELEEN finally makes it through the crowd and enters the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks past the tables and steps on the stage. She che curtain to find that there is no backstage. She enters th kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUELEEN almost trips over REESE and TRIPLETTE and another are talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, I'm Sueleen Gay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm John Triplette. Excuse me. I  got all caught up in looking at you.  You'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, why thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I see your costume?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She removes her coat and exposes a costume that looks lik picture of a frosty glass or gin and tonic on a hot day.  TIRIPLETTE stares blatantly and REESE can hardly keep his off her. SUELEEN starts into her routine as a matter of  survival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like it?  Listen, where is the  pianist?  I need to go over this  with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands over a stack of music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all didn't say what you wanted  to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRIPLETTE smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someday I'm gonna be a star like  Barbara Jean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRIPLETTE puts his arm around her and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sueleen, you're prettier and  probably sing better. Besides, she  is unusually sick. And tonight you  have the opportunity to work in  front of some grateful gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue to walk past the many places.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever done this before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakes her head, "no" quite caught up in air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's not too hard. You'll  sing whatever it is you want to  sing. They'll applaud like crazy  'cause I can tell them that you're  really something and then the piano  and drum will give you a little  fanfare and you can sing and take  off your clothes or not sing. It  really doesn't make much difference,  really. But since you've never done  this before, singing might help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are near three enormous beef legs waiting to go into oven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now this is to raise funds for  someone who can help people who are  less fortunate than yourself. The  more you take off, you see, more  money we can raise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (like a robot) I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that you are an artist and I  am sure you are very religious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods "yes."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this is for people who have a  kind of religious belief in the way  they live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waiters come in to serve the salad and the rolls and starts to carve the meat. We FOLLOW one of the waiters in banquet hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is almost full. The pianist and the drummer are on the stage. At the far end of the roam, we SEE someone enter f street, go to the sign and read it.

dialogues.speaker: DOORWAY AND CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: It is ALBUQUERQUE reading "banquet." The door to the room and she goes down another corridor and disappears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The men have finished their dinner and SUELEEN finishes h The applause is thunderous. SUELEEN looks to the kitchen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRIPLETTE is applauding like crazy. REESE in beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She blows kisses then runs to TRIPLETTE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think they'd just love  another song instead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Sueleen, you know that's not  what we talked about right here in  this very room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too late. The ANNOUNCER speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're ready to striiippppp... for  cash, gentlemen. The time has come  to dig deep. Our little Sueleen in  going to dig deep for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are a few chortles. Suddenly she freezes. TRIPLETTE her and kisses her hair. Page missing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRIPLETTE encases her in her coat. TRIPLETTE yells someth about bringing her clothes as the audience goes crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALBUQUERQUE is totally fascinated and delighted, applaudi the point of almost giving herself away. She picks up SUE clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REESE drives SUSLEEN home. He is drunk. He double-parks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we are, Sueleen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks out the window and nods. He gets out and opens door as LADY PEARL walks past them on her way to the loun STAR drives up behind REESE'S double-parked ear and has t around it. SUELEEN starts for her room, but REESE follows close. Finally, he turns her around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sueleen... Sueleen Gay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His look says what he wants. She is terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to walk quickly, but he grabs her arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute!  I want to look at  you. C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please, Oh, God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes her against one or the storefronts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon! I Just wanna look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He squeezes her arm and she screams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I wanna look really good.  You know what I mean? Do you?  Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is about to pass out from terror, when all or a sudde eases of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TRICYCLE MAN stands and watches a few feet away. SUEL terror now is divided between the two men. REESE can't ha the way the TRICYCLE MAN looks at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He releases SUELEEN, turns and runs up the street. She sl down and hugs herself. The TRICYCLE MAN doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be okay... It'll be okay... I  know it'll be fine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a while, she pulls herself up and starts up the sta her room. The TRICYCLE MAN watches until she is gone, the across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOM enters with L.A. JOAN. The place in crowded. WADE sit table with LINNEA. She hasn't seen TOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in prison for twenty-eight  years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Premeditated murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just got out. Had me thirteen  lawyers. Missed the electric chair  twice. .. Been out three months.  Are you heavy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm forty-six. Do you like to go  up or down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High?  Do you ever get high? A walk  on the wild side. Ever do dust?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before TOM can sit down he is called on stage by the MC. present are BILL, MARY and NORMAN, talking about NORMAN'S OPAL, who interviews them. LINNEA sees TOM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I need is fifteen minutes a  night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen minutes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep. That's all I need. Don't  want to waste no time sleeping. You  married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...?  0h, yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me. Ain't never loved anybody.  Ain't never been married. Won't  either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOM stands at the mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening. Thanks. I used to  be part of a group. You remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody laughs.

dialogues.speaker: TON
dialogues.text: Well, they're here, Bill and Mary. We're cutting a record So far, they've done all the work. It's an accident they' I've been hiding from them for days now, right? Everybody laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet your sweet ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone laughs.

dialogues.speaker: LINNEA AND WADE
dialogues.text: She in lost in the sound of his voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who that is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOM calls BILL and MARY to the stage. The three of them b into:  "Since You've Gone."  When they finish, BILL and M down again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to sing a new song for  you. I threw away a good one I wrote  yesterday. maybe it was the day  before -- anyway.. Let's go here,  'I'm Easy.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOM seems to know where LINNEA is sitting and directs the her. After he finishes, he gives the guitar back to its o and Joins L.-A. JOAN to walk out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WADE starts in again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love, that's a word that's been  overused. I'll say I sure like you.  Maybe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LINNEA is wiping her eyes with a hanky. A large group of people starts out the door, among them T L.A. JOAN. TOM steers himself and JOAN to LINNEA'S table. and MARY catch him there. All the while he is talking to he writes a note and places it in LINNEA'S lap. OPAL walk TOM. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, we're suppose to sing on TV  day after tomorrow. At the park...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: National?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Percy Warner Park'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you staying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that for that Walker guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but we're just singing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sue was trying to get hold of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. He's a crook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What crook?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a Roman Catholic. You're  Baptist, I bet. Catholic means  universal, everything, know what I  mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods again. She can't make out the writing with out h glasses and she doesn't want to put them now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a scholar of the Bible as well  and we're all going to answer to  God. Have you read the book of  Revelations?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods 'yes.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever read the 'Apocalypse  Unsealed?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is too curious. She takes out her glasses and looks t them lorgnette style as WADE continues to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not coming anywhere near that  place. He's a rotten guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a politician.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He saw us at Tammany Hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hell he did. Look, I'll see  you in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bet. Nine, right?  But count  me out of that other thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOM takes L.A. JOAN and leaves. LINNEA panics, BILL burns and MARY watch after TOM, NORMAN keeps silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother. died in '72. They told  me after. They said they couldn't  find me before, so they told us  after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They said go see the chaplain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry but I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up quickly and leaves. Everybody is gone, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to self)  I'm a hundred years old and when  I'm two hundred, I'll die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As LINNEA hurries off, we SEE STAR sitting in his pickup watching and waiting for ALBUQUERQUE. END OF MONDAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TRICYCLE MAN is helping KENNY fix the car, changing t etc. KENNY is under the hood. When he comes out, KENNY te the TRICYCLE MAN how grateful he is and that he wouldn't what to do if he hadn't shown up. The TRICYCLE MAN just f the job.

dialogues.speaker: EXT SHOPPING CENTER PARKING LOT
dialogues.text: A platform has been erected in the center of the parking BARBARA JEAN'S bus is parked nearby. There is a large cro several people gathered around the platform. GLENN is amo so is TRIPLETTE, REESE and OPAL. Radio station personnel musicians prepare for the show. Finally, the bus door ope BARNETT leads BARBARA JEAN to the platform. The musicians and she sings. The sound comes from many huge speakers an people come from stores and shops to hear. BARBARA JEAN segues from one song to another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNETT stands to the side, talking to various people TRI pulls his sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, for heaven's sake. You're  just about everywhere, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: THIPLETTE
dialogues.text: I came out to see how you all were doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I should tell you I know  why you're here. The answer is no  ... we don't get involved in  politics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs good- naturedly)  Well, that's not entirely true,  Barnett. At least not according to  Haven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven? Hell,' we've been playing  poker together since we were  fourteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess that's why he thought you  right want to help out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's probably because it  would help him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody likes to be as good as  their word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His Word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His word? Are you telling me Haven  promised you something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's pretty close. He's going to  be on the bill. Why not put Barbara  Jean on with him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRIPLETTE'S last sentence is caught in silence as BARBARA has stopped singing in the middle of a phrase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds the mike and looks at Barnett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnett..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She faints. There in a moment of confusion, then GLENN is stage protectively as the musicians clear the people out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNETT vaults through the crowd pushing TRIPLETTE aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get her feet up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls himself on the stage. She is coming to and sees face looking at her and rubbing her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He carries her to the bus. TRIPLETTE is forced to watch f distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARBARA JEAN has come to and she and BARNETT are alone in back of the bus. He studies her carefully for a minute an decides she'll be all right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Barnett, I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, it's okay... How do you feel  now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All those people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She fights back the tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I'll take care or it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He blows her a kiss and steps from the bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNETT sends the nurses inside. GLENN has pushed to fron the crowd. BARHETT grabs a hand mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's fine now, folks. Just too  soon after the hospital, I guess. (he pauses) She won't be able to continue and  she's in the bus crying her eyes  out, because she doesn't want to  disappoint the people who love her  the most.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a group groan. BARNETT looks for some under-stan but there is none. There are several catcalls and GLENN, near BARNETT, becomes so enraged, he tries to find the ca There is almost a fight, but TRIPLETTE intervenes. He gla GLENN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, come on. You don't want  to waste your energy on that fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catcalls continue from other parts of the audience. TRIPL shouts against GLENN, who has turned his intensity to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's frail. You never saw anybody  so frail. I've seen her breathe hard  just standing still, dammit. You're  selfish. Worst selfish I've ever  heard. What if she died?  Would you  like that?  You'd probably say she  faked it so they could make money.  Well, you're just dumb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could invite them to the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They can come to the concert in the  park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said 'no!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNETT studies the angry crowd then TRIPLETTE, who is ho back GLENN against them. The crowd is even more angry

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to crowd) We're very Sorry... Please... If  you'll listen. (he makes the  decision) You can see her tomorrow at Percy  Warner Park...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLENN has disengaged from TRIPLETTE'S hold and pushed his the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Triplette, I want to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moves closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got trapped and you know it, so  let's have some rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. Listen, Barnett, I  understand your position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you don't, so don't say you do.  Bunch of damn liars. What do you  get out or this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing; Barnett. It's my job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your job, huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He removes a pen and paper and writes down the following speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She will not appear on the stage or  support that Walker guy and you  can't have any of his signs up while  she sings. She'll be on first and  out of the park before he shows up.  There will be no pictures, no  questions, no answers or tying her  name up with his now or in the  future to come. Any money she makes  will go to the President of the  United States.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He calls over his secretary and makes TRIPLETTE sign the  statement. Then the secretary signs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see you tomorrow. I'll send  her three songs over this afternoon.  She'll be done about ten minutes  after she starts and Walker better  not show up till she's through. Now,  get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRIPLETTE extends his hand expecting friendship. BARRETT it. As TRIPLETTE leaves, a MAN who has been after BARNETT attention steps up. BARNETT turns to his secretary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnett?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharply) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Barnett, I have this terrific  song I've been working on. It would  be a natural for Barbara Jean. Like  you to take a look at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BARNETT looks at him suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very busy right now. (to secretary)  Get me Haven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll just take a minute. Here,  I'll even hold it for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BABNETT sighs and skims over the paper. Song stealing is same as horse stealing to BARNETT. He becomes enraged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where you got this,  but something tells me you stole it  and I hate thieves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MAN takes the paper back and tries to walk away from BARNETT yells after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you an engineer...?  I know  you -- Don't you work at one of  those cut a record places...?  Twenty-five bucks a shot, isn't it?  Usually their last twenty-five...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MAN backs up and BARNETT follows him. They have enter crowd. The MAB starts to run. BARNETT runs after him. Whe MAN gets into the car. BARNETT picks up a rock, throws it hits the windshield with it. The car MISFIRES but finally starts.. As the MAN drives off, BARNETT stands watching u he's out of sight.

dialogues.text: We SEE a fairground, then a roller rink, and a wrestling and finally a small portable stage in the center of a cir track. The grandstands are partially ruled and stock cars from another part or the field; Around the stage -we SEE a sign that says, "Talent Show T and we see the contestants and the MC, and NORMAN doing a with an accordion player. After NORMAN finishes, the NC t the mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mr. Berguan. And now we  bring you, 'Albuquerque.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALBUQUERQUE walks to the mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, everybody. My name is  Albuquerque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are-a few nasty remarks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to sing a wonderful tune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to sing, "You're an Old Smoothie," and as she stock cars leave the pit and drive to the entrance of the ALEBUQUERQUE, disturbed at first, sings louder. The cars waiting for the talent show to set off the track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Albuquerque starts to take off her clothes. The MC hasn't noticed, but the grandstand has. People shout, "Take it o ALBUQUERQUE loves it. Before ALBUQUERQUE can remove the l garments, the MC rushes over and grabs the mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd 1ike~to announce the winner of  tonight's contest. Albuquerque, How  about some applause for a darling  little lady

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm not through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's all, folks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stands are calling to have her take it all off and he contestants are furious. RAVEN, BUD and PEARL are there a discuss her act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here is the twenty dollars first  prize money and a seat in the  grandstands and now let's turn the  show over to Al Allen in the race  stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He shuts oft the mike.

dialogues.speaker: TRACK
dialogues.text: The stock cars start around the track and stop in front o race announcer.

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: Congratulations to Albuquerque and  welcome, everyone, to the Memorial  Race for Billy Apple, who died a  week ago in a wreck at this very  track, and we want you to know his  last words were, 'Are the other  fellows all right?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wave of applause and we SEE the talent show make its wa the rack. The platform is already torn down and the MC is helping ALBUQUERQUE dress. As she passes the drivers, the and she blows them a kiss and loses her first garment as does. More cheers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cars are dented. On the side of one car it says, "Hav Hamilton," and now we see him, BUD and PEARL in the stand the side of another car it says, "Connie White."

dialogues.speaker: AL
dialogues.text: Want you all to save a dime every day and next Saturday w take up a collection and give it all to Billy Apple's wif Share. Their four kids will sure miss their daddy. Want t announce Bob Trilltree is out of the hospital now. Hope y be back with us soon. All right, would you stand, please? The people stand to a scratchy record of the National Ant '74 Pontiac circles the track with a man holding a medium American flag which flaps as the convertible drive.. At t of the song the Pontiac drives off the track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.text: That's unkind.

dialogues.text: That's what you said before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
